Description: Hollow gold bead or pendant of fusiform shape made of sheets of metal, one embossed and welded on a flat underside. The top of the embossed part is decorated by three horizontal grooves, with a transversal round hole pierced for suspension under the mid groove.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, From the desert surface around the site.
Curator's comments: Among the gold "beads and foil ornaments" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 76 § 73, "gold pendant, hollow, flat back", ibid., p. 110, pl. xli, 27.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 76 § 73, p. 110, pl. xli, 27)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.82, p.186, pl.28)
